FeedItems.Title: View dependent packages on NuGet.org
FeedItems.Summary:
There are several ways to evaluate packages on NuGet.org, such as download statistics, update frequency, owner reputation, GitHub Usage, and more.
Today, we’re excited to announce that you can...

FeedItems.Title: Advanced search on NuGet.org
FeedItems.Summary: We are excited to announce that NuGet.org now supports one of our top customer asks – advanced search! You can now use a multitude of sorting and filtering criteria to help find the best NuGet...

FeedItems.Title: NuGet.org will permanently remove support for TLS 1.0 and 1.1 on June 15th
FeedItems.Summary: Last November, we shared our two-stage plan for deprecating TLS 1.0/1.1 on NuGet.org in which we stated that the permanent removal of TLS 1.0/1.1 support would occur in April 2020. However, in April,...

FeedItems.Title: NuGet.org will continue to support TLS 1.0 and 1.1 until further notice
FeedItems.Summary: Last November, we shared our two-stage plan for deprecating TLS 1.0/1.1 on NuGet.org and actions you can take today to ensure your systems use TLS 1.2. In that post, we announced that NuGet.org would...

FeedItems.Title: Deprecating TLS 1.0 and 1.1 on NuGet.org – Stage 1
FeedItems.Summary: Last November, we shared our two-stage plan for deprecating TLS 1.0/1.1 on NuGet.org and actions you can take today to ensure your systems use TLS 1.2. In this post, we will go into more details and a...

FeedItems.Summary:

At Microsoft, using the latest and secure encryption techniques is very important to us to ensure the security and privacy of our customers. TLS 1.0 and TLS 1.1,...

FeedItems.Title: Deprecating packages on nuget.org
FeedItems.Summary: We are excited to announce that nuget.org now supports package deprecation. This has been a long standing ask that will help the ecosystem use supported packages. As a package publisher on nuget.org,...

FeedItems.Title: New and improved NuGet Search is here!
FeedItems.Summary: It’s been a long time coming, and today we are excited to announce the new and improved search on NuGet.org leveraging Azure Search. We want to start this post with a huge thanks to you, the NuGet...

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Restore: excessive deep cloning of ProjectSpec, remove cloning in no-op hash creation for PR projects" (#10052) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Related to https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/9041. 

One of said clones is in https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/0b178b9d10f7876fc7daa18487844f28d6bfea6b/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Commands/RestoreCommand/Utility/NoOpRestoreUtilities.cs#L196-L225. 

That's arguably unnecessary cause it was already considered in https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/commit/967f1586cb225c90f17c6abdf7dfb03ffcfbb123#diff-c6b7f00df939531ce334b386ef6922b4.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Project List sorting on Version or Installed does not restore when Solution PMUI is reopened" (#10054) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
In Solution PMUI, you have a projects list shown. Sorting is persisted in user settings. However, I have noticed that the Installed/Version columns appear not to restore correctly.
I've debugged, and the values are read from settings, so I think somewhere our XAML overrides this or has issues with this column's type.

_Columns for reference:_
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49205731/93658351-d648d080-fa08-11ea-8ebd-8dc3829228b1.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Enable recommender for PackageReference style projects" (#10053) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Enable package recommendations in Package Manager for PackageReference style projects. This is currently enabled only for packages.config style projects.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Restore: excessive deep cloning of ProjectSpec, remove cloning in no-op hash creation for PR projects" (#10052) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Related to https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/9041. 

One of said clones is in https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/0b178b9d10f7876fc7daa18487844f28d6bfea6b/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Commands/RestoreCommand/Utility/NoOpRestoreUtilities.cs#L196-L225. 

That's arguably unnecessary cause it was already considered in https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/commit/967f1586cb225c90f17c6abdf7dfb03ffcfbb123#diff-c6b7f00df939531ce334b386ef6922b4.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "add dotnet nuget verify command to dotnet docs" (#10051) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: This task is created to track https://github.com/dotnet/docs/issues/20701

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "SDK side implementation for dotnet nuget verify command" (#10050) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
`NuGet.Client` side work was completed for `dotnet nuget verify command` and can be tracked [here](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/8051).

This task is created to track SDK side implementation for this new command. https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/issues/13702

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Signing: implement dotnet verify command" (#8051) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Implement "dotnet verify" command according to NuGet.exe command "nuget verify".

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Instead of waiting for nominations or 20s whichever comes first, implement a sliding window at solution load, which should allow us to run exactly 1 restore even for large solutions" (#9984) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "Advanced Search on NuGet.org" (#46) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
The spec for 'Advanced Search on NuGet.org' is ready for **review**:
